pageContext.claim: “Your GDP numbers, as you know, the first quarter -- or the last quarter for the previous administration -- was not good. And if you look at them now, we're hitting 3s routinely, and we had a 3.2. ”
pageContext.analysis: Trump routinely touts quarterly GDP growth of 3 percent, suggesting the figure was unheard of being he took office. But GDP growth has routinely topped 3 percent on a quarterly basis. Most recently, GDP growth hit 3.2 percent in the first quarter of 2015 while Obama was still in office.
